title: AVP, IT Solutions Delivery - Finance
content:
Job Summary
This position plays a key role in the organization by managing business application solution delivery for the Finance department in support of F&G’s strategic goals and objectives.  A sizable component of the position is leading teams who are executing multiple projects within IT Solutions Delivery to support Finance Business Partner initiatives while improving IT ways of working. This position is responsible for the development and execution of the IT Finance and Actuary roadmap. 
Duties and Responsibilities


Accountable for the development of target state Finance roadmaps to ensure technology initiatives align with enterprise strategy in partnership with IT Architecture and Engineering.
Collaborate with Finance Business Partners to achieve a Target State Finance Operating model enabled by Reporting & Analytics, Process, Data, Technology, People and Policy. 
Responsible for working with Finance Business Partners to achieve a target state operating model enabled by ERP and other leading technologies. 
Responsible for workforce planning within area of responsibility, working with leaders to review future staffing needs, propose staffing model changes, and ensure plans are developed/budgeted to address skill risks/gaps.
Responsible for working with leaders in area of responsibility to understand engagement, develop plans for improvement/maintenance and to develop/drive team goals.
Accountable for planning and execution of multi-year Finance roadmaps, inclusive of Core Finance, Actuarial, Pension Risk Transfer (PRT), and Reinsurance technologies.
Accountable for leading efforts to improve the Finance development lifecycle leveraging automation, innovation, and process improvements.
Accountable for the escalation of all technology issues related to the delivery of the Finance Project Portfolio.
Understand industry trends, tools, and practices, partnering with business unit and IT peers to assess capabilities needed to support company strategies for product development.
Engage with business unit peers to understand Finance roadmaps and translate them into technology initiatives and solutions.
Accountable for Finance Architecture, building technical automation and innovation in support of capability models for the Finance business unit.
Act as the IT Sponsor on key projects within area of responsibility and participate in steering committees.
Oversee solution delivery efforts and project teams, provide input to capability planning, ensure solutions adhere to quality assurance, security and compliance standards while meeting business outcomes. Ensure efforts are delivered on time and within budget.  
Accountable for vendor relationships for Finance functions (i.e., implementation partners, managed services, TPA’s and other strategic partners) to ensure contract terms, SLAs, and performance agreements are met along with changes/ enhancements are managed appropriately.
Participate in the development of RFPs and review proposals to determine buy vs. build solution. Negotiate contracts with SLAs, performance agreements and incentives/ penalties.
Responsible for managing risk and compliance to minimize exposure, and align with disaster recovery guidelines. 

Experience and Education Requirements

S. or B.A. required, advanced degree preferred
10+ years of Information Technology leadership
4+ years’ experience managing cross-functional development team.
Extensive experience with ERP Finance Applications (i.e. Oracle, Workday, SAP)
Strong insurance experience.
Experience with Actuarial and Reinsurance technologies
Demonstrated experience leading teams in the Life and Annuity Insurance market; preferred experience working within Life & Annuities Finance IT Delivery function.
Experience leading Finance, Actuarial, Reinsurance, and/ or PRT technology implementations.
Project Management experience a plus, PMI certification a plus.
Experience managing third-party administrator (TPA), COTS and managed service vendors.
Experience designing, developing, implementing, and monitoring adherence to policy, process, procedures, and standards.
ITIL certification a plus
Significant technical financial and contract management experience
Extensive service level management experience; SAS70 knowledge a plus
Business Process Re-Engineering, Six Sigma or Lean a plus

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Knowledge of Life and Annuity Product Lifecycle needs, and automation trends.
Knowledge of Financial Services industry a plus
Ability to work with business unit and IT peers to prioritize and understand technology and project needs.
Ability to communicate effectively across the organization for Finance technology enablement.
Aptitude to manage multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously. Excellent project management skills.
Ability to effectively lead and develop teams, coordinate team activities, and mobilize workforce.
Strong and current technical proficiency with applications architecture, frameworks, and enterprise solutions delivery
Significant expertise in testing principles, disciplines, tools, and environments
Participated in IT strategic planning and architectural design; established policies and standards.
Strong networking and relationship-building across the organization, with service providers and COTS vendors
Current knowledge of solution and information security, compliance and disaster recovery principles.
Strong fiscal focus including budgets, ROI and Cost Benefit Analysis
Consultative and client-oriented, a creative problem solver with a collaborative nature
Executive Leadership with ability to influence/negotiate with peers and vendors.
Professional, decisive with integrity and high ethical standards

Other Requirements

Perform other functions, duties and projects as assigned
Regular and punctual attendance
Minimal travel required (less than 10%)

#LI-MB1 #LI-RemoteAdditional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 
2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022
